member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.FilteredElementCollectorExtensions
member.summary: Revit FilteredElementCollector extensions

remarks.p: Developers can assign a variety of conditions to filter the elements that are returned. This class requires that at least one condition be set before making the attempt to access the elements.
Revit will attempt to organize the filters in order to minimize expansion of elements regardless of the order in which conditions and filters are applied.

There are three groups of methods that you can use on a given collector once you have applied filter(s) to it. One group provides collections of all passing elements, a second finds the first match of the given filter(s), and a third provides an iterator that is evaluated lazily (each element is tested by the filter only when the iterator reaches it). You should only use one of the methods from these group at a time; the collector will reset if you call another method to extract elements. Thus, if you have previously obtained an iterator, it will be stopped and traverse no more elements if you call another method to extract elements.

In .NET, this class supports the IEnumerable interface for Elements. You can use this class with LINQ queries and operations to process lists of elements. Note that because the ElementFilters and the shortcut methods offered by this class process elements in native code before their managed wrappers are generated, better performance will be obtained by using as many native filters as possible on the collector before attempting to process the results using LINQ queries.

One special consideration when using this class in .NET: the debugger will attempt to traverse the members of the collector because of its implementation of IEnumerable. You may see strange results if you also attempt to extract the first element or all elements from the collector while the debugger is also looking at the contents of the collector.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.FilteredElementCollectorExtensions.GetElements(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document)
member.summary: Searches for elements in a document
member.param: The document
member.returns: A new FilteredElementCollector that will search and filter the set of elements in a document
member.exception: The collector does not have a filter applied. Extraction or iteration of elements is not permitted without a filter

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.FilteredElementCollectorExtensions.GetElements(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document,Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId)
member.summary: Searches for elements in a document
member.returns: A new FilteredElementCollector that will search and filter the visible elements in a view

remarks.p: Elements that will be passed by the collector have graphics that may be visible in the input view. Some elements may still be hidden because they are obscured by other elements.

For elements which are outside of a crop region, they may still be passed by the collector because Revit relies on later processing to eliminate the elements hidden by the crop. This effect may more easily occur for non-rectangular crop regions, but may also happen even for rectangular crops. You can compare the boundary of the region with the element's boundary if more precise results are required.

Accessing these visible elements may require Revit to rebuild the geometry of the view. The first time your code constructs a collector for a given view, or the first time your code constructs a collector for a view whose display settings have just been changed, you may experience a significant performance degradation.

member.param: The document that owns the view
The view id
member.exception: viewId is not valid for element iteration, because it has no way of representing drawn elements. Many view templates will fail this check.

member.param: The document that owns the elements matching the element ids
member.returns: A new FilteredElementCollector that will search and filter a specified set of elements in a document

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ImperialExtensions
member.summary: Imperial Units Extensions

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ImperialExtensions.FromFraction(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string representation of a measurement in the Imperial system (feet and inches) to a double value.
member.param: The Imperial system number as a string (e.g., 1'-3/32").
member.returns: The equivalent value in feet as a double.
member.exception: Thrown when the input string has an invalid format.
member.remarks:
This method handles input in the format of feet, inches, and fractional inches. It supports several variations:
Whole feet (e.g., 1')
Fractional inches (e.g., 1/8")
Feet and fractional inches (e.g., 1'-3/32")
Feet and decimal inches (e.g., 1'1.75")
The method will convert these values into a total feet measurement, returning the result as a double.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ImperialExtensions.TryFromFraction(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Attempts to convert the string representation of a measurement in the Imperial system (feet and inches) to a double value, returning a success flag instead of throwing an exception on failure.
member.param: The Imperial system number as a string (e.g., 1'-3/32").
When this method returns, contains the converted value in feet if the conversion was successful; otherwise, 0.
member.returns: true if the string was successfully converted to a double; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
The method does not throw exceptions on invalid input, but instead returns false. It supports several variations of the Imperial system format:
Whole feet (e.g., 1')
Fractional inches (e.g., 1/8")
Feet and fractional inches (e.g., 1'-3/32")
Feet and decimal inches (e.g., 1'1.75")

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ImperialExtensions.ToFraction(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a double value representing a measurement in feet to its string representation in the Imperial system, expressed as feet, inches, and fractional inches with a specified denominator.
member.param: The measurement in feet as a double.
The denominator used for fractional inches (8 for 1/8", 16 for 1/16").
member.returns:
A string representation of the measurement in feet, inches, and fractional inches. For example:
0.0123 input with a denominator 8 returns 1/8"
12.006 input with a denominator 16 returns 12'-1/16"
25.222 input with a denominator 32 returns 25'-2 21/32"

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ImperialExtensions.ToFraction(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a double value representing a measurement in feet to its string representation in the Imperial system, expressed as feet, inches, and fractional inches. The default denominator for fractional inches is 8.
member.param: The measurement in feet as a double.
member.returns:
A string representation of the measurement in feet, inches, and fractional inches, using 1/8" increments. For example:
0.0123 input returns 1/8"
12.011 input returns 12'-1/8"
25.222 input returns 25'-2 1/8"

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ImperialExtensions.FromFraction(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Attempts to convert the string representation of a measurement in the Imperial system.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.AreGlobalParametersAllowed(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document)
member.summary: Tests whether global parameters are allowed in the given document.
member.remarks: First of all, global parameters can be had in main project documents only; they are not supported in family documents. However, there may also be other circumstances due to which global parameters may be disallowed in a particular project, either temporarily or permanently.
member.param: A revit document of interest.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.GetAllGlobalParameters(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document)
member.summary: Returns all global parameters available in the given document.
member.param: The document containing the global parameters
member.returns: A collection of GlobalParameters
member.exception: Global parameters are not supported in the given document. A possible cause is that it is not a project document, for global parameters are not supported in Revit families.

member.summary: Finds whether a global parameter with the given name exists in the input document.

Name of the global parameter
member.returns: GlobalParameter, or null if it was not found.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.IsValidGlobalParameter(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document,Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId)
member.summary: Tests whether an ElementId is of a global parameter in the given document.
member.param: The document containing the global parameter.
Id of a global parameter
member.returns: Returns True if the Id is of a valid global parameter; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.IsUniqueGlobalParameterName(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document,System.String)
member.summary: Tests whether a name is unique among existing global parameters of a given document.
member.remarks: Typically, this method is used before a new global parameters is created, for all global parameters must have their names unique in the scope of a document.
member.param: Document in which a new parameter is to be added.
A name of a parameter being added.
member.returns: True if the given %name% does not exist yet among existing global parameters nof the document; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.GetGlobalParametersOrdered(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document)
member.summary: Returns all global parameters in an ordered array.

remarks.p: The order of the items corresponds to the order at which global parameters appear in Revit UI when shown in the standard Global Parameters dialog. However, the order of parameters is serialized in the document, thus available on the DB level as well.

member.param: Document containing the requested global parameters
member.returns: A list of Global Parameters in the document.
member.exception: Global parameters are not supported in the given document. A possible cause is that it is not a project document, for global parameters are not supported in Revit families.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.SortGlobalParameters(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Document,Autodesk.Revit.DB.ParametersOrder)
member.summary: Sorts global parameters in the desired order.

remarks.p: All global parameters are sorted, but only within the range of their respective parameter group.

This operation has no effect on the global parameters themselves. The sorted order is only visible in the standard Global Parameters dialog. However, the order of parameters is serialized in the document, thus available on the DB level as well.

member.param: Document containing the global parameters to be sorted
Desired sorting order
member.exception: Global parameters are not supported in the given document. A possible cause is that it is not a project document, for global parameters are not supported in Revit families.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.MoveUpOrder(Autodesk.Revit.DB.GlobalParameter)
member.summary: Moves given global parameter Up in the current order.

remarks.p: A parameter can only be moved within its parameter group, meaning that repeated moving a parameter will not push the parameter out of and into the next (in order) parameter group. When a parameter can no longer move because it is at the boundary of its group, this method returns False.

This operation has no effect on the global parameters themselves. The rearranged order is only visible in the standard Global Parameters dialog. However, the order of parameters is serialized in the document, thus available on the DB level as well.

member.param: The parameter to move up
member.returns: Indicates whether the parameter could be moved Up in order or not.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.GlobalParametersManagerExtensions.MoveDownOrder(Autodesk.Revit.DB.GlobalParameter)
member.summary: Moves given global parameter Down in the current order.

remarks.p: A parameter can only be moved within its parameter group, meaning that repeated moving a parameter will not push the parameter out of and into the next (in order) parameter group. When a parameter can no longer move because it is at the boundary of its group, this method returns False.

This operation has no effect on the global parameters themselves. The rearranged order is only visible in the standard Global Parameters dialog. However, the order of parameters is serialized in the document, thus available on the DB level as well.

member.param: The parameter to move Down
member.returns: Indicates whether the parameter could be moved Down in order or not.

member.name: T:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.RibbonExtensions
member.summary: Contains extension methods for creating and managing custom Ribbon elements in the Revit UI. These extensions provide simplified methods for adding panels, buttons, and other controls to the "Add-ins" tab or any custom tab in the Revit ribbon. These utilities streamline the process of integrating external commands and tools into the Revit user interface.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.RibbonExtensions.CreatePanel(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIControlledApplication,System.String)
member.summary: Creates or retrieves an existing panel in the "Add-ins" tab of the Revit ribbon.
member.param: The Revit application instance.
The name of the panel to create.
member.returns: The created or existing Ribbon panel.
member.remarks: If a panel with the specified name already exists in the "Add-ins" tab, it will return that panel. Otherwise, a new panel will be created with the given name.
member.exception: Thrown when the panelName is empty.
Thrown if more than 100 panels were created in the session.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.RibbonExtensions.CreatePanel(Autodesk.Revit.UI.UIControlledApplication,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates or retrieves an existing panel in a specified tab of the Revit ribbon.
member.param: The Revit application instance.
The name of the panel to create.
The name of the tab in which the panel should be located.
member.returns: The created or existing Ribbon panel.
member.remarks:
If the tab doesn't exist, it will be created first.
If a panel with the specified name already exists within the tab, it will return that panel; otherwise, a new one will be created.
Adding a panel also supports built-in tabs. To add a panel to the built-in Revit tab, specify the panel ID or name as the parameter.
member.exception: Thrown when or is empty.
Thrown if more than 100 panels were created, or if the maximum number of custom tabs (20) has been exceeded.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ElementTransformUtilsExtensions.CopyElements(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId},Autodesk.Revit.DB.View,Autodesk.Revit.DB.View)
member.summary: Copies a set of elements from source view to destination view.

remarks.p: This method can be used for both view-specific and model elements.

Both source and destination views must be 2D graphics views capable of drawing details and view-specific elements (floor and ceiling plans, elevations, sections, drafting views.) Drafting views cannot be used as a destination for model elements.
The pasted elements are repositioned to ensure proper placement in the destination view (e.g. elevation is changed when copying from a level to a different level.)
The destination view can be in the same document as the source view.
The destination view can be the same as the source view.
All view-specific elements in the set must be specific to the source view. Elements specific to views other than the source view or to multiple views cannot be copied.
This method performs rehosting of elements where applicable.

member.param: The view in the source document that contains the elements to copy.
The set of elements to copy.
The view in the destination document that the elements will be pasted into.
member.returns: The ids of the newly created copied elements.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.ElementTransformUtilsExtensions.CopyElements(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementId},Autodesk.Revit.DB.View,Autodesk.Revit.DB.View,Autodesk.Revit.DB.Transform,Autodesk.Revit.DB.CopyPasteOptions)
member.summary: Copies a set of elements from source view to destination view.

remarks.p: This method can be used for both view-specific and model elements.

Both source and destination views must be 2D graphics views capable of drawing details and view-specific elements (floor and ceiling plans, elevations, sections, drafting views.) Drafting views cannot be used as a destination for model elements.

The pasted elements are repositioned to ensure proper placement in the destination view (e.g. elevation is changed when copying from a level to a different level.) Additional transformation within the destination view can be performed by providing additionalTransform argument. This additional transformation must be within the plane of the destination view.
The destination view can be in the same document as the source view.
The destination view can be the same as the source view.
All view-specific elements in the set must be specific to the source view. Elements specific to views other than the source view or to multiple views cannot be copied.
This method performs rehosting of elements where applicable.

member.param: The view in the source document that contains the elements to copy.
The set of elements to copy.
The view in the destination document that the elements will be pasted into.
The transform for the new elements, in addition to the transformation between the source and destination views. The transformation must be within the plane of the destination view.
Optional settings.
member.returns: The ids of the newly created copied elements.
member.exception: The given element id set is empty. -or- The specified view cannot be used as a source or destination for copying elements between two views. -or- Some of the elements cannot be copied, because they belong to a different document. -or- Some of the elements cannot be copied, because they belong to a different view. -or- The elements cannot be copied into the destination view. Drafting views cannot contain model elements. -or- The transformation is not within the plane of the destination view. -or- The input set of elements contains Sketch members along with other elements and the Sketch Id of those members isn't in the set.
It is not allowed to copy Sketch members between non-parallel sketches. -or- The elements cannot be copied.
User cancelled the operation.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.FamilyUtilsExtensions.CanConvertToFaceHostBased(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Family)
member.summary: Indicates whether the family can be converted to face host based.
member.param: The family.
member.returns:
True if the family can be converted to face-based. Otherwise false, which will be returned if there any family instances exist in the project, the family is already face-based, or the family does not have a host. Also, false is returned if the family does not belong to one of the following categories:
OST_CommunicationDevices
OST_DataDevices
OST_DuctTerminal
OST_ElectricalEquipment
OST_ElectricalFixtures
OST_FireAlarmDevices
OST_LightingDevices
OST_LightingFixtures
OST_MechanicalControlDevices
OST_MechanicalEquipment
OST_NurseCallDevices
OST_PlumbingEquipment
OST_PlumbingFixtures
OST_SecurityDevices
OST_Sprinklers
OST_TelephoneDevices

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.FamilyUtilsExtensions.ConvertToFaceHostBased(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Family)
member.summary: Converts a family to be face host based.
member.remarks: Converts a family hosted by some element other than a face to be hosted by a face. This is done by replacing the existing host (wall, roof, ceiling, floor) with a face. Conversion can succeed only if FamilyUtils.FamilyCanConvertToFaceHostBased() returns true.
member.param: The family.
member.exception: The input familyId cannot be converted to face host based.
Failed to convert the family to face host based. -or- The family is already unhosted.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.PlumbingUtilsExtensions.ConnectPipePlaceholdersAtElbow(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Connector,Autodesk.Revit.DB.Connector)
member.summary: Connects placeholders that looks like elbow connection.
member.remarks: The placeholders may have physical connection or may not connect at all. In the latter case, the first one connects to the end of second one. If connection fails, the placeholders cannot be physically connected.
member.param: The first end connector of placeholder to be connected to.
The second end connector of placeholder to be connected to.
member.returns: True if connection succeeds, false otherwise.
member.exception: The owner of connector is not pipe placeholder. -or- The owners of connectors belong to different types of system.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.PlumbingUtilsExtensions.ConnectPipePlaceholdersAtTee(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Connector,Autodesk.Revit.DB.Connector,Autodesk.Revit.DB.Connector)
member.summary: Connects three placeholders that looks like Tee connection.
member.remarks: The three placeholders may or may not have physically connections. However, the first one should be collinear with the second and third one must have intersection with first and second. If first placeholder and second placeholder have the same size, the second one is merged with first one and original placeholder element will be invalid. If connection fails, the placeholders cannot be physically connected.
member.param: The first end connector of placeholder to be connected to the second.
The second end connector of placeholder to be connected to the first.
The third end connector of placeholder to be connected to the first or second.
member.returns: True if connection succeeds, false otherwise.
member.exception: The owner of connector is not pipe placeholder. -or- The owners of connectors belong to different types of system. -or- The curves of connector1 and connector2 are not collinear or either the connecto1 or connector2 is not connector of curve end.

member.summary: Connects placeholders that looks like Cross connection.
member.param: The first end connector of placeholder to be connected to the second.
The second end connector of placeholder to be connected to the first.
The third end connector of placeholder to be connected to the forth.
The fourth end connector of placeholder to be connected to the third.
member.returns: True if connection succeeds, false otherwise.
member.exception: The owner of connector is not pipe placeholder. -or- The owners of connectors belong to different types of system. -or- The curves of connector1 and connector2 are not collinear or either the connecto1 or connector2 is not connector of curve end.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.WorksharingUtilsExtensions.GetCheckoutStatus(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Element)
member.summary: Gets the ownership status of an element.

remarks.p: This method returns a locally cached value which may not be up to date with the current state of the element in the central. Because of this, the return value is suitable for reporting to an interactive user (e.g. via a mechanism similar to Worksharing display mode), but cannot be considered a reliable indication of whether the element can be immediately edited by the application. Also, the return value may not be dependable in the middle of a local transaction. See the remarks on for more details.
For performance reasons, the model is not validated to be workshared, and the element id is also not validated; the element will not be expanded.

member.param: The element itself.
member.returns: A summary of whether the element is unowned, owned by the current user, or owned by another user.

member.name: M:Nice3point.Revit.Extensions.WorksharingUtilsExtensions.GetCheckoutStatus(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Element,System.String@)

remarks.p: This method returns a locally cached value which may not be up to date with the current state of the element in the central. Also, the return value may not be dependable in the middle of a local transaction. See the remarks on for more details.
For performance reasons, the model is not validated to be workshared, and the element id is also not validated; the element will not be expanded.

member.param: The element itself.
The owner of the element, or an empty string if no one owns it.
member.returns: An indication of whether the element is unowned, owned by the current user, or owned by another user.

member.param: The element itself.
member.returns: Worksharing information about the specified element.

member.summary: Obtains ownership for the current user of as many specified worksets as possible.

remarks.p: For best performance, check out all worksets in one big call, rather than many small calls.
When there comes a contention error when locking the central model, this API would wait and retry endlessly until getting the lock of the central model.

member.param: The document containing the worksets.
The ids of the worksets to attempt to check out.
member.returns: The ids of all specified worksets that are now owned, including all that were owned prior to the function call.
member.exception: document is not a workshared document. -or- document is not a primary document, it is a linked document. -or- document is read-only: It cannot be modified. -or- document has an open editing transaction and is accepting changes. -or- There are one or more ids with no corresponding workset. -or- Saving is not allowed in the current application mode.
The file-based central model could not be reached, e.g. the network is down or the file server is down.
Access to the central model was denied due to lack of access privileges. -or- Access to the central model was denied. A possible reason is because the model was under maintenance.
The central model are locked by another client.
The central model is overwritten by other user. -or- The central model is missing. -or- An internal error happened on the central model, please contact the server administrator.
Last central version merged into the local model has been archived in the central model. This exception could only be thrown from cloud models.
Operation is not permitted when there is any open sub-transaction, transaction, or transaction group.
The server-based central model could not be accessed because of a network communication error.
An internal error happened on the server, please contact the server administrator.

Revit may check out additional elements that are needed to check out the elements you requested. For example, if you request an element that is in a group, Revit will check out the entire group.

member.remarks: This method provides a preview of the user worksets available in a file, allowing an application to look up the necessary workset ids and information to properly fill out a WorksetConfiguration structure before opening or linking to this model.
member.param: The path to the workshared model.
member.returns: Information about all the user worksets in the model. The list is sorted by workset id.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer
